metadata.Title: CVE-2022-3594 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - negligible
metadata.Description:
A vulnerability was found in Linux Kernel. It has been declared asproblematic. Affected by this vulnerability is the function intr_callbackof the file drivers/net/usb/r8152.c of the component BPF. The manipulationleads to logging of excessive data. The attack can be launched remotely. Itis recommended to apply a patch to fix this issue. The associatedidentifier of this vulnerability is VDB-211363.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-3594` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.15.0-56-generic - 5.15.0-56.62
linux-image-5.15.0-56-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-56.62
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-56-generic - 5.15.0-56.62
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-56-generic-64k - 5.15.0-56.62
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1024-kvm - 5.15.0-1024.29
No subscription required

linux-oem-6.0: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of life, was needs-triage').
linux-oem-6.1 package in jammy is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication.
linux-aws-6.2 package in jammy is affected and needs fixing.
